meaningMnemonic: An <radical>arrow </radical>is shot from <radical>heaven</radical> and hits right between your <radical>mouth</radical> and your <radical>mustache</radical> to <kanji>correct</kanji> your crooked smile. It also <kanji>straighten</kanji>s your teeth and the crooked cut of your mustache too. Who told you that looked good? Well, it doesn't matter. The heaven arrow corrected it for you.
readingMnemonic: These heavenly <kanji>correct</kanji>ing arrows actually come from <reading>きょう</reading>と. They hate seeing people with crooked mustaches, so they shoot them out on the regular. It just looks like they're coming from heaven because they fall out of the sky.
